main event: A stationary, metallic object was observed on radar for about 20 seconds near Reims, France in 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared sharply defined and metallic on the radar.
The object disappeared suddenly after being stationary for about 20 seconds.
A RCAF officer also reported a visual sighting of an object that was white in color, approximately 5-10 feet in diameter with a 3-4 foot center cylinder.
The RCAF officer observed the object moving from east to west and then directly overhead before disappearing.
An analysis by the French Air Force found a scorched and flattened grass area approximately 30 yards by 15 yards where a light was observed to land, but no trace of a craft was found.
sighted object: stationary metallic object on radar; white cylindrical object observed visually
